intro: Gynestum strictum, commonly known as the slender gynestum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, erect stems and small, umbrella-like clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Gynestum strictum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
